Technical difficulties with the submarine or diving equipment, such as malfunctioning oxygen tanks or faulty navigation systems.
Unexpected changes in water pressure or temperature, causing discomfort or panic among the team members.
Encountering unexpected marine life, such as a giant squid or school of sharks, which could pose a threat to the safety of the team.
Difficulty communicating with the team or base camp due to signal interference or communication equipment failure.
Running out of essential supplies or resources during the mission, such as food or medical supplies.
